snippet: The African National Congress's accomplishments as a liberation movement are extraordinary. Too bad its record as a party-in-government is a mixed bag.
abstract: The African National Congress's accomplishments as a liberation movement are extraordinary. Too bad its record as a party-in-government is a mixed bag.
lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG - Africa's oldest liberation movement, the African National Congress (A.N.C.), held a lavish birthday bash last weekend to celebrate its founding 100 years ago. More than 40 heads of state gathered in the small church in the small city of Bloemfontein, the A.N.C.'s birthplace, to celebrate the party's role in defeating white-minority rule and apartheid. And deservedly: the A.N.C.'s accomplishments as a liberation movement are extraordinary.
